Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the achievement of removing almost 30 sites from the Superfund priorities list, stating that it has "almost never been done" when in fact the EPA has removed 30 or more sites in previous fiscal years.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the EPA has removed 30 or more sites from the Superfund priorities list in previous fiscal years.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to back up the assertion that removing almost 30 sites from the list has "almost never been done."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that removing almost 30 sites from the Superfund priorities list is an unprecedented achievement without providing sufficient evidence to support this assumption.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not specifying whether it refers to calendar years or fiscal years, which leads to a false statement.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists, as the claim could have been referring to fiscal years instead of calendar years, in which case the statement would have been accurate.
